title: Evolving Interests
description: Explore how your interests and passions change and grow together.

questions.text: When my interests or passions change, I...
choices: Love exploring the new direction
Sometimes worry about losing what I loved
Wonder if you'll still connect with me
See it as natural growth

therapeutic.rationale: Responses to changing interests reflect attachment and identity concerns. Exploration-lovers embrace novelty; loss-worriers fear abandonment of self; connection-wonderers fear partner disconnection; natural-growers normalize change. All reveal valid concerns.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different responses to changing interests are normal. The explorer and the loss-worrier may need different reassurance.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared responses to changing interests create mutual understanding during personal evolution.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you feel when your interests change? What do you need from your partner during these shifts?

questions.text: When you develop a new interest I don't share, I...
choices: Am curious and want to learn about it
Am happy you have something you love
Sometimes feel left out
Try to find ways to connect with it

therapeutic.rationale: Responses to partner's separate interests reveal attachment security. Curiosity shows openness; happiness shows security; left-out feelings show connection needs; connection-seeking shows effort. All are understandable responses.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different responses to separate interests are all valid. The left-out feeler needs more inclusion; the happiness-feeler may need to offer more connection.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched responses create aligned expectations about how to handle separate interests.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you feel when your partner develops interests you don't share? Is that working for you both?

questions.text: It's important to me that we...
choices: Have some interests we share
Support each other's separate passions
Stay curious about each other's worlds
Grow together even as we change individually

therapeutic.rationale: Values about shared vs. separate interests reflect needs for togetherness and autonomy. Shared interests create connection; supporting separate passions creates space; curiosity maintains knowledge; growing together balances both. All are healthy values.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different values about interests require balance. Too much overlap may feel suffocating; too little may feel disconnected. Find your right balance.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared values about interests create clear expectations for how you'll navigate passions together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's the right balance of shared and separate interests for your relationship?

questions.text: Something I'd love to share with you is...
choices: An interest or hobby I'm passionate about
A new experience I want us to try
A goal or dream I'm working toward
A part of my world you haven't seen yet

therapeutic.rationale: Desires to share reveal what we value and want our partner to know. Passions represent our energy; new experiences represent growth; goals represent aspirations; unseen worlds represent intimacy. Sharing deepens connection.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different sharing desires point to different invitations. All are opportunities for deeper connection.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched sharing desires create clear opportunities for exploring together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What would you love to share with your partner that you haven't yet?

questions.text: I believe interests in a relationship should...
choices: Include both shared and individual pursuits
Evolve and grow over time
Be sources of connection, not competition
Be respected even when not understood

therapeutic.rationale: Beliefs about interests shape how couples navigate passions. Shared-and-individual balances togetherness and autonomy; evolution normalizes change; connection prevents competition; respect without understanding honors difference.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: All these beliefs support healthy interest navigation. They're complementary perspectives.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared philosophy about interests creates aligned expectations for how passions fit in your relationship.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What role should individual and shared interests play in your relationship?
